statement:
For any non negative continuous random variable having distribution
function $F(X)$ we have the followings:

1.  $E[X]=\int_{0}^{\infty}Pr[X>t]dt$

2.  $E[X^r]=r\int_{0}^{\infty}t^{r-1}Pr[X>t]dt$

3.  $E[\min(X,T)]=T-\int_{0}^{\infty} F(T)dt$

4.  $E[X|X<T]=T-\frac{1}{T}\int_{0}^{T}F(t)dt$ where $T$ is a constant.
names: Expectation of a non negative random variable
